result.markdown:
---
title: UC Reserve System Environmental Data 
description: --Basic Plotting of Environmental Variables
author: RJ Cody Markelz
categories: [data, research, forest, reserve, fire, tutorial]
date: 2022-02-01
image: /images/post_thumbnails/reserve_elevation_species.png
---



A short post on keeping small datasets in a data directory on my site, infiling the data, and then manipulating it.

The UC Reserve System has a many [data sources](https://ucnrs.org/research-resources/) including species lists. For this post I used the [Plant Species List](https://ucnrs.org/plant-list/) Excel File compiled by Brian P. Haggerty and Susan J. Mazer of UC Santa Barbara. I did a little data cleaning on this multi-tabbed spreadsheet.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
eco_data <- read.csv("~/DATA/data/reserve-eco-data.csv")
```
:::


Take a quick look at how the data is structured.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
glimpse(eco_data)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Rows: 36
Columns: 11
$ UC.Natural.Reserve                        <chr> "Año Nuevo Island Reserve (s…
$ X..Unique.Species..excluding.ssp....var.. <int> 0, 42, 55, 87, 150, 159, 170…
$ X..Taxa.including.ssp....var.             <int> 0, 45, 72, 88, 151, 162, 173…
$ Reserve.Size..ha.                         <int> 10, 18624, 8, 11, 69, 22, 24…
$ Elevation.Low..m.                         <int> 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1250, 21, 0, …
$ Elevation.High..m.                        <int> 13, 742, 2, 15, 12, 4012, 58…
$ Elevation.Range..m.                       <int> 13, 742, 2, 15, 12, 2762, 37…
$ Precipitation..cm.                        <int> 50, 50, 22, 62, 77, 32, 46, …
$ Temperature.Low...C.                      <chr> "4", "10", "9", "12", "6", "…
$ Temperature.High...C.                     <chr> "24", "22", "25", "15", "24"…
$ X                                         <chr> "24", "22", "25", "15", "24"…
```
:::
:::


Data clean up and header labeling.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
eco_data <- eco_data[1:10]
names(eco_data)[1:10] <- paste(c("reserve", "unique", "taxa", "size", "elevation_low", "elevation_high", "elevation_range","precip", "temp_low", "temp_high"))
names(eco_data)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] "reserve"         "unique"          "taxa"            "size"           
 [5] "elevation_low"   "elevation_high"  "elevation_range" "precip"         
 [9] "temp_low"        "temp_high"      
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
eco_data$temp_high <- as.numeric(eco_data$temp_high)
```
:::


The classic precipitation vs. temperature ecological plot.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
classic <- ggplot(eco_data, aes(x=temp_high, y = precip)) +
geom_point() +
scale_x_continuous(name="High Temp (C)") +
scale_y_continuous(name="Precipitation (mm)")
classic
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Another quick plot.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
elevation_plot1 <- ggplot(eco_data, aes(x=elevation_range, y = unique)) +
geom_point() +
scale_x_continuous(name="Elevation Range (m)") +
scale_y_continuous(name="Number of Unique Species")
elevation_plot1
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggsave("~/DATA/images/post_thumbnails/reserve_elevation_species.png")
```
:::
